ARABIC: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ سَأَلَ سَآئِلٌۢ بِعَذَابٍ وَاقِعٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: An inquirer asked about an impending punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: AN INQUIRER ASKED for the affliction that is to come
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: A beseecher besought the visitation of chastisement,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Someone has (needlessly) demanded to experience the torment (of God),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: A requester seeks the punishment that will take place –
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: A questioner asked concerning a torment about to befall
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: One demanding, demanded the chastisement which must befall
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: A questioner asked of a chastisement about to fall
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: A questioner questioned concerning the doom about to fall
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: A doubter once demanded that punishment be immediately meted out,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: There hath asked an asker for the torment about to befall.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: An asker asked for a punishment sure to befall
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: A questioner asked about a Penalty to befall-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: A questioner asked concerning a torment about to befall
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: A caller supplicated about a punishment to fall on
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: A questioner questioned the imminent torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [70:1] A petitioner petitioned, a supplicator supplicated [for], an impending chastisement
